qas.question: A group of neuron-clusters scattered in the core of the lower brain is called what?
Reticular neurons transfer signals to what part of the brain?
Damage to the reticular formation can cause what?
The SCN transfers signals to a set of areas that implement what?

context: The SCN projects to a set of areas in the hypothalamus, brainstem, and midbrain that are involved in implementing <a3_0>sleep-wake cycles.<a3_0/> An important component of the system is <a0_0>the reticular formation<a0_0/>, a group of neuron-clusters scattered diffusely through the core of the lower brain. Reticular neurons send signals to <a1_0>the thalamus<a1_0/>, which in turn sends activity-level-controlling signals to every part of the cortex. Damage to the reticular formation can produce a permanent <a2_0>state of coma<a2_0/>.
